poem.author: Phillip Camitses
poem.title: Deserts Come and Deserts Go
verses: Is it a desert, only time will tell, </br> a landscape between heaven and hell. </br> Every ten thousand years or so, </br> the ice will come, the ice then will go.
In one place the ocean throws water across the land, </br> another place flowers beyond numbers to count grow. </br> In time, only a desert will tell, </br> the span between heaven and hell.
